intro: Chloanthes verbascina, commonly known as the velvetleaf sunflower, is a striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, where it thrives in warm, humid climates. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its fibrous roots and robust stems make it a hardy plant well adapted to various soil types.
